title: Don't Attack People Who Are Bad In Normals
body:
Normals are where everyone is told to practice new champs or learn new roles.  Honestly it's a horrible place to learn with how inconsistent it is (playing against a Diamond one game and a Bronze the next game) but that's the best we've got.  

That said, berating players for being bad at the champion or role they are trying to practice doesn't help them get better.  Unless you want people first time a new champion or role in ranked, then let them do it in a normal.

It's great hearing your support go, "Our top sucks.  Do we even have an jungler?  Mid won't leave lane.  And our ADC is missing CS.  Just FF and go back to bots, yall suck."  It's a normal game, geez, let people learn.  You aren't going to be demoted because you lose a normal game.

I mean, or how about we just don't berate people at all? If they make mistakes then they're obviously learning, insulting them won't help them improve and it won't make you win your game regardless of whether it's ranked, normals, or even coop vs ai.

That aside I agree with the post. Berating people for learning is stupid.

Most of my time spent nowadays is on the PBE, and let me tell you. It is filled with some of the most toxic tryharding players I have ever seen. And I don't mean tryhards as in "I wanna win this game", no that's normal in any game. I mean tryhards as in "If you pick Morgana mid I'm trolling"

And, as always, if even a single thing goes wrong in champ select OR in game, you can expect an all out flame war in chat. With PLENTY of all chat messages to voice their complaints with the enemy team. 

It's PBE. A server where there is: Absolutely zero matchmaking, permanent autofill for everyone, imbalance when new things are introduced, and a primary need for bug finding more than anything else.

If I just sound like a whiner at this point, maybe this will convince people how bad it is. A few days after Pyke was on PBE, several people outright demanded someone who wanted Pyke NOT to play them or they'd troll/afk. Their reasoning? "He's so shit atm" or something close to that. 

**_They demanded their team NOT play the new champion in PBE because they felt weak to them._**

So I guess what I'm trying to say is: Chill people. You're not one game away from winning the LCS championship. You're not at risk for losing your house if the game is lost. Most of the time I'm willing to bet that LP isn't even on the line. If they're outright blatantly trolling, just quietly ignore them and report them after the game. No need to cause a scene. Just. Chill.

While I agree that normal game isn't exactly the best place to berate players... You also learn best when you learn to accept criticism.

By characterizing normals as a place players go to 'learn', you've automatically opened the door for criticism.

Are you there to learn?  Then learn to accept criticism.

So I think that you have to step back.  It may be that players are going to normals expecting to just have fun and not care about learning... and that's why they don't care about criticism.

But if the point of your post was to complain about berating players for no purpose (as opposed to berating them as a form of criticism), then that sort of behavior doesn't belong anywhere (normals, ranked, ARAM, URF, TT, ...)  So there is no relevance to you emphasizing that players go to normals to 'learn'.

At this point, I just try new champions in custom games.  I find it so much more reliable. I get to practice their combos, test out the damage output, how effectively it can clear the jungle or at which point it gets to clear waves well etc.

Also, I try champions on my smurf account. Like it or not, it's probably the best bet. Playing in silver, ranked games are more serious than normals, but the competition isn't as hard, so I know that with a new champion, I'd at least be kinda on the same level, so it's a good training ground.
